basics.name: Isaac Fernandes
basics.label: Information Security Analyst
basics.summary: Experienced Information Security Analyst with expertise in Detection Engineering, Threat Hunting, Digital Forensics and Incident Response (DFIR), and Security Operations Center (SOC) management. Proven ability to improve security posture, reduce false positives, and enhance incident response capabilities.

education.institution: IFCE - Instituto Federal de Educação, Ciência e Tecnologia do Ceará

work.name: Capgemini
work.position: Security Consultant V | SOC Detection Engineer
work.summary: Detection Engineering, Detection as code with gitlab and github, Threat Hunting, DFIR, QRadar Management, Splunk, Crowdstrike, Jira, Resilient, Detect Mitre, Confluence, Playbook Creation, Purple Team exercises with Caldera and Atomic Red team.

work.name: Ish Tecnologia
work.summary: Threat Hunting, Digital Forensics, Incident Response, RSA Netwitness Management, Securonix SNYPR, Kape, Volatility, Dettect, Mitre, TaHiTI, MAGMA, NIST, ServiceNow, Reporting, Documentation Creation, Daily Meetings with Customers
highlights: Evolution in Information Security Maturity of Large Brazilian Companies

work.name: MORPHUS SEGURANÇA DA INFORMAÇÃO
work.summary: Threat Hunting, Digital Forensics, Incident Response, RSA Netwitness Management, Securonix SNYPR, Kape, Volatility, Dettect, Mitre, TaHiTI, MAGMA, NIST, ServiceNow, Reporting, Documentation Creation, Daily Client Meetings
highlights: Maintained security for multiple large companies in Latin America.

work.name: ENERGY TELECOM
work.summary: Management of PRTG Network Monitor, Centreon, Icinga, Troubleshooting Sonicwall, Sophos, Routing, Switching, DHCP, DNS, NAT, Service Desk Telephone and Qualitor, Documentation of routine checklists for Bacula, Veeam, vSphere Data Protection, and Backup Exec backups.
highlights: Ensured availability of critical assets for important companies in Brazil.

work.name: PHOTONICS LABORATORY
work.summary: Research in Photonics, Numerical Simulations, Optical Communication Systems, Article Writing, Support for the Annual Iecom Meeting on Communications, Networks, and Cryptography
highlights: Fundamental scientific contribution in the field of optical computing.

volunteer.summary: Conducted computer classes for underprivileged individuals as part of a social project course.
Organized events and lectures aimed at reducing student dropout rates in the Telecommunications Engineering program.

skills.name: Practical Ethical Hacking - The Complete Course

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
